meanings.definition: A group of people traveling together in a single vehicle, typically to work or school.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the carpools from our neighborhood gather to drive to the office together.
meanings.sent2: The school organized carpools to reduce traffic congestion during drop-off and pick-up times.
meanings.sent3: The carpools to the beach were so full of laughter and chatter, it felt like a party on wheels.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of cars, the carpools stood out like a school of fish swimming in unison.
meanings.sent5: The image of the carpools weaving through traffic stuck in my mind like a colorful thread.

meanings.definition: To participate in a carpool by sharing a ride with others.
meanings.sent1: I carpools with my colleagues to save money on gas and reduce our carbon footprint.
meanings.sent2: She carpools with her neighbors to make the daily commute more enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: When he carpools, he always brings snacks to share, making the journey more fun.
meanings.sent4: The idea of carpools symbolizes teamwork and cooperation in our community.
meanings.sent5: Carpools allow us to bond with others while contributing to a greener environment.
